tweets.text: @seethingabout @EnvAgency @RBKingston EA stated they granted permission 2 spray Glyphosate to  control 1 plant - Himalayan Balsam - been observing this site for yrs and never seen Balsam, meanwhile, since 2018 the majority of flora has been killed by regularly spraying - now looks like a war zone https://t.co/ht8uwK9d6p
Now you see it now you don't https://t.co/I9QZeL5F0G

urls.description: A virtual festival where many people join together for better, greener cities.

tweets.text: Join us online on Mon 22nd from 3.15pm (GMT) to explore Cody Dock, the river Lea and how biodiversity, community, art and culture make London a fantastic first #NationalParkCity Visit https://t.co/XITdk9g79i to register! #TogetherForOurPlanet #greenrecoverychallengefund https://t.co/5GXr32e9Cj

You'd think the EA would've required some evidence of the weed from the developers as Seething Wells Filter Beds is a SINC (Site of Interest for Conservation). Their permission led to the site being destroyed. Review HERBC012175 now! @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA

@WombourneParish @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @SevernTrentLife I understand that a small amount of sewage is allowed but is this a law passed due the inadequate sewage system we have?  Worryingly there are new homes, a care home and nursery currently being a few metres from the brook.  Will this compound the problem?

Just a tiny amount of the sewage waste collected today from the Wombrook on the poolhouse stretch yet again today. Mainly sanitary towels and toilet / baby wipes.  @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @SevernTrentLife what will you do? @WombourneParish https://t.co/jRlauU91pY

Always watch the sea state

Know exit points on a beach

@EnvAgencySW @RNLI

#Ecocide is criminalized human activity that violates the principles of environmental justice by damaging or destroying ecosystems.

urls.title: Flood wardens | Kent Prepared
urls.description: Flood wardens are volunteers trained to help and prepare people in local communities that are at risk of flooding. They play an important role in the preparing a community flood plan and putting it in to practice. They also provide a vital link between a local community and those responsible for responding to a flood. You will be the eyes and ears of the community and will help develop your local flood plan. You can choose to meet with other flood wardens in your community as often as you like, typically

tweets.text:
Did you listen to @JennyNewhamEA on @BBCRadioKent today? Our need for volunteer flood wardens.

Interested? 

To find out more, go to https://t.co/pI0bHmsMk1

To register for virtual training, Wed 24 Feb, go to https://t.co/o4yDEipze7 - search for Kent Flood Warden Training https://t.co/kBCItUWlli

It's so sad to see the canal you love polluted by oil and diesel. Watching helplessly as ducks and geese struggle through the slime. It's been like this for five days, worsening, and the cause hasn't been found. #Retweet #PeakForestCanal @BBCNWT @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency https://t.co/oKzQsGztFK

tweets.text: @JoKingDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW Shocking. Well done reporting it, Jo, and great video. The public are eyes and ears of the EA as resources have been cut so much. Keep the 0800807060 number and, however inconvenient, keep reporting. Suggest you get the name of the officer responding and send them the video too.

@JoKingDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW Your voice is one calling attention to this pollution. Hope more will see it & report it. Your voice counts. You do inspire others not to ignore these criminal acts.
The Environment Agency granted a permit for the use of glyphosate weed killer for the eradication of one plant at Seething Wells, without any evidence of it being present
Near English Bridge looking upstream on the Severn @shrewsmorris @IsabelMathiasPR @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @LensAreLive @ThePhotoHour @ShrewsburyHour @Discover_Shrops https://t.co/amHHQLBFUn
